text.__SUMMARY__: Penicillium westlingii is a species of fungus in the genus Penicillium which was isolated from soil near Poznan in Poland. Penicillium westlingii produces citrinin and sterol.
text.Further reading:
Houbraken, J.; Frisvad, J. C.; Samson, R. A. (2011). "Taxonomy of Penicillium section Citrina". Studies in Mycology. 70 (1): 53–138. doi:10.3114/sim.2011.70.02. PMC 3233908. PMID 22308046.
